sub_title: Sr Technical Assistance Facility Manager at Common Fund for Commodities
summary: Experienced social scientist with demonstrated experience in the international development cooperation sector in various positions, including on commission by bilateral donors, academia, intergovernmental institutions, the NGO sector as well as private sector. Skilled in project management, organisational analysis, data collection and analysis, evaluation, and in relation building. Trained through post-graduate level (Research Master of Science (ResM.Sc.) in International Development Studies, University of Amsterdam).

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': 3965529, 'name': 'Common Fund for Commodities', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQHlpE6QfNMroQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1597225889020?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=i4qHt7r1Jl84Y_Hd3GYbULy3B309igdxZKdSp2NFwlQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/common-fund-for-commodities/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Common Fund for Commodities', 'description': 'The Common Fund for Commodities (CFC) is an autonomous intergovernmental financial institution established within the framework of the United Nations. The Agreement Establishing the Common Fund for Commodities was negotiated in the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) from 1976 to 1980 and became effective in 1989. 

The Common Fund for Commodities’ Technical Assistance Facility team partners with impact-oriented investment funds in the agricultural commodities sector to leverage the development impact and commercial sustainability of their investments into agribusinesses in the developing world. The TA Facility team comprises staff with expertise in tropical agriculture, agroforestry, project management, impact assessment and ESG risk management, and is being assisted by CFC financial and administrative colleagues. By leveraging this expertise, the TA Facility team aims to improve the operational capacity and profitability of targeted agribusinesses and partner institutions through providing expert consultancy and capacity development support and ensuring knowledge dissemination on agriculture and agri-finance, with a specific focus on smallholder supply chains and sourcing models.

Capacity development measures may consist of support through hands-on and customized services to investees, including, scientific studies, impact evaluations, community development projects, market/value chain analyses and feasibility studies, salary subsidies for company key positions, outgrower scheme development, and the development and coaching of Social and Environmental Management Systems (SEMS).

Currently, the Common Fund for Commodities TA Facility team manages two separate facilities, the Africa Agriculture Trade and Investment Fund (AATIF) Technical Assistance Facility and the Moringa Investment Fund Agroforestry Technical Assistance Facility (ATAF), with projects spanning across Latin America and Africa.', 'title': 'Sr Technical Assistance Facility Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Swedish Development Advisers', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Gothenburg, Sweden', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Swedish Development Advisers', 'description': 'SDA carries out evaluations and organisational reviews of public, private and civil society organisations across the world. SDA works on commission by bilateral and multilateral donors, governments, CSOs, NGOs, and financial institutions and provides expertise in organisational development, evaluation of international development cooperation projects and programmes, and advice on how to implement change. 

SDA’s most recent client portfolio includes donor agencies such as Sida, Norad, DANIDA, African Development Bank, World Bank Group, as well as international civil society organisations such as Save the Children Norway, Union to Union, International Legal Assistance Consortium, Diakonia, Swedish Mission Council, and Swedish Society for Nature Conservation. 

SDA was founded 1985 in Gothenburg, Sweden. SDA combines practical experience from managing private and public organisations with experience from working in emerging economies. Since the start, SDA has served some 60 clients in more than 400 projects around the world.', 'title': 'Evaluator & Analytical Consultant in international development', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre', 'description': 'Achievements:
